intro: Vandenboschia fallax, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, ribbed leaves. It produces vibrant yellow or orange blooms during the cooler months, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Vandenboschia fallax is often cultivated in rock gardens and xeriscapes due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
